pages.title: Corail Tombstone
pages.text: Corail Tombstone prevents you from losing your belongings on death by keeping them in a grave, with many features of survivability and dimensional teleportation centered around grave's souls.$(br)It also introduces a perk tree, Knowledge of Death, and a magic system based on some items with the help from Souls haunting Decorative Graves.

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.text: When you die, a grave near your death point with your items will be created. When you respawn, you are given a key which will highlight your grave when held, this key also unlocks your grave. The key can be enchanted to teleport to your grave. (recipe above)

pages.title: Knowledge of Death
pages.text: Press $(k:tombstone.message.knowledge_of_death) to open the Knowledge of Death menu.

When you perform certain actions, you gain 'Knowledge points' which can be spent on perks. $(br2)Actions that gain Knowledge points:$(br)- Using a grave's soul to enchant an item$(br)- When a soul is freed from a receptacle$(br)- Praying near a decorative grave with an Ankh of Pray (with a cooldown of 6 in-game hours)$(br)- By accomplishing the tombstone advancements.

pages.title: Decorative Graves
pages.text: Decorative graves primary purpose (other than being decorative) is to provide the player with souls.$(br2)Souls will sometimes fly over graves which can be caught, or be used to enchant items like scrolls or tablets.$(br2)Graves can be engraved on an anvil with an iron ingot.

pages.title: Souls
pages.text: Souls will occasionally appear hovering over a decorative grave.$(br2)Souls can be captured with a receptacle by right clicking the soul.$(br2)Items can be enchanted by right clicking a soul, these items include Scrolls, Tablets and Grave Keys.

pages.title: Scrolls
pages.text: Scrolls function similarly to potions. On activation, they will give you their respective effect.$(br2)Scrolls can be crafted but must then be enchanted by using them on a soul.$(br)Crafting recipes are found on the last page of this entry

pages.title: Tablets
pages.text: Tablets activate teleport related abilities, such as locating a structure or teleporting to a dungeon.$(br2)Tablets can be crafted but must then be enchanted by using them on a soul, but not all tablets let you use the soul right away.$(br)Crafting recipes are found on the last page of this entry

pages.title: Receptacles
pages.text: Receptacles can be used to capture a soul from a grave, this is will give you a Soul Receptacle.$(br2)Soul Receptacles can prevent death when in your inventory. Upon death, the Receptacle will break.$(br)They can also be used to store souls for later use on decorative graves.

pages.title: Ankh of Pray
pages.text: Allows one to pray on a grave to earn some knowledge points, and can also be used on a soul to reset the perks tree (the soul is consumed)$(br2)The item has a cooldown of 6 in-game hours

pages.title: Book of Disenchantment
pages.text: The Book of Disenchantment can strip enchantments from items with the help of a soul and turn them into enchanting books.$(br2)The item to disenchant must be in the left hand slot when the book is used on a grave soul.

pages.title: Enchantments
pages.text: $(l)Soulbound:$()$(br)The item with this enchantment will be kept on death.$(br2)$(l)Shadowstep:$()$(br)Reduces the distance that monsters detect you and slightly reduces falling damage. (sneaking increases effect. doesn't work while riding. Boots only.)$(br2)$(l)Magic Siphon:$()$(br)Absorbs beneficial effects from the target. (Weapons only)

pages.title: Dust of Vanishing
pages.text: Allows you to quickly retreat from enemies that have seen you by teleporting you back a few steps.

pages.title: Unlucky Fishing
pages.text: A regular fishing rod, but you have very bad luck when fishing. Using on a soul makes makes the rod infinite but the unlucky effect worsens.

pages.title: Grave's Dust
pages.text: Grave's Dust is the base crafting ingredient required for most recipes in this mod, it is a 10% drop from undead monsters.
